TEXT: The applicant is a NORP national , born in DATE . He lives in GPE .
A.
On DATE the applicant was elected mayor of the city of GPE , an administrative centre of LOC of GPE .

The mandate of the previous ORG ( hereinafter referred to as the “ ORG ” ) expired in DATE . DATE elections to the ORG were fixed and postponed several times . The elections took place in DATE and DATE , but were found invalid because of certain informalities , including insufficient participation by the electorate and a disputed outcome .

In DATE and CARDINAL the ORG was not elected as the local executive and law enforcement authorities were involved in a number of court disputes as to the proper manner in which to hold the elections . During those proceedings a number of administrative decisions were taken , but subsequently quashed . In DATE and DATE the elections took place several times , but were found invalid because of various informalities including , once more , insufficient participation by the electorate and a disputed outcome .

On DATE the applicant ’s mandate as the mayor of GPE expired . On DATE ORG refused to register him as a candidate in the next mayoral elections . The elections took place on DATE , but were found invalid due to various informalities . Upon the applicant ’s appeal against the decision preventing his candidacy , on CARDINAL DATE ORG upheld that decision . The applicant appealed to ORG . The applicant contends that the appeal is currently pending .

By a decree of DATE the President of GPE authorised the Governor of ORG to appoint an acting mayor of GPE on the ground that the applicant ’s mandate had expired . On DATE the Governor appointed an acting mayor . The applicant applied to court , contesting the lawfulness of that appointment . He stated in particular that his term continued as long as his successor was not elected . On DATE ORG confirmed the lawfulness of the Governor ’s decision . On DATE ORG rejected at first instance the applicant ’s action whereby he had alleged that the presidential decree of DATE had been null and void . On DATE ORG upheld that decision . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal against the judgment of DATE .
It appears that to date neither ORG nor the mayor has been elected .
PERSON Relevant domestic law
The LAW of GPE
Pursuant to LAW , the ORG consists of “ federal subjects ” ( PERSON федерации ) which can have their own constitutions , statutes and legislation .

Under LAW , “ ORG authority ” is exercised by the President of GPE , the ORG , the ORG and courts . Pursuant to LAW , ORG authority which is vested in the federal subjects is also exercised by the competent authorities of those entities .
Legislative power is exercised by ORG ) .
Under LAW , local authorities are not considered as having ORG authority ( i.e. legislative , executive or judicial powers ) within the meaning of the LAW .

Federal subjects enjoy a number of autonomous rights , including inter alia the right to exercise , jointly with the competent federal authorities , legislative power in various political , economic , social and legal fields ( Articles DATE and DATE ) . Articles DATE and CARDINAL of the LAW entitle the federal subjects to exercise legislative power in those areas which do not relate to the exclusive competence of the ORG or the joint competence of the LAW and “ federal subjects ” .
The Maritime Territory is a “ federal subject ” of GPE ( DATE ) .
Laws of the Maritime Territory
The status of the Maritime Territory is defined in LAW and the Statute of the Maritime Territory . The Statute was passed by PERSON ( hereinafter referred to as the “ ORG ” ) on DATE .

Under LAW , legislative power in LOC is exercised by the local residents by way of referendum , and by the ORG . The ORG is the only legislative organ in the territory , and consists of CARDINAL representatives elected for DATE ( LAW ) . The Governor is the head of the executive in the LOC territory ( LAW ) .
Under LAW , the local authorities do not exercise “ ORG authority ” ( i.e. legislative , executive or judicial powers ) .

The mandate , functions , powers and controls of the local authorities , including municipal councils and mayors , are defined in ORG ( hereinafter referred to as the “ Act ” ) , which was adopted by the ORG on DATE . Municipal councils and mayors are elected by local residents ( Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the Act ) , and election procedures are specifically governed by special laws passed by the ORG . Pursuant to LAW , local authorities can adopt regulations and by - laws in the areas in which the LAW confers such competence upon them .
